Class BoardAdjTargetTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.BoardAdjTargetTests

  • public class BoardAdjTargetTests
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoardAdjTargetTests() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void setUp() 
      void testAdjacenciesWithinRooms()
      ====================================================== Adjacency Testing ==================================================== Tests adjacency within rooms, ensures that the player does not move around within a room marked as ORANGE in the spreadsheet - Locations that are within rooms( have empty adjacent list) - Locations that are at the edge of the board
      void testAdjacencyBesidesRoomCell()
      - Testing Locations that are besides a room cell that is not a doorway - Testing Locations that are adjacent to a doorway with direction (this includes the doorway itself in the adjacency list) These tests are GREEN in the planning spreadsheet
      void testAdjacencyOnlyWalkway()
      - Testing adjacency for a cell that only has walkway as adjacency - Testing locations that are doorways only.
      void testAdjacencyWalkwaysVariety()
      Test variety of walkway scenarios - Tests the bottom edge of the board These are marked as RED on the spreadsheet
      void testRoomExit()
      Testing here when we are exiting the room - Testing locations here are doorways These are marked as LIGHT GREEN on the testing
      void testTargetsFourStepsAdjDoorway()
      Testing a step size of 4 - Locations that are adjacent to a doorway with needed directions.
      void testTargetsIntoRoom()
      Testing getting into rooms These tests are in LIGHT PURLE on the spreadsheet
      void testTargetsOneStepAdjEdgeDoorway()
      ============================================== Target Testing ============================================================= In the testTargetOneStep() - Testing target of length 1 - Testing Location with only walkway as adjacent locations - Locations that are besides a room cell that is not a doorway - Locations that are at the edge of the board - Locations that are adjacent to a doorway with directions.
      void testTargetsTwoStepsAdjDoorway()
      In testTargetsTwoSteps() I am testing a different distance of size 2 - Testing locations that are adjacent to doorway, in this case UP and DOWN These are LIGHT BLUE on the spreadsheet
      void testTargetWithinARoom()
      testing target within a room, which should be zero

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        ====================================================== Adjacency Testing ==================================================== Tests adjacency within rooms, ensures that the player does not move around within a room marked as ORANGE in the spreadsheet - Locations that are within rooms( have empty adjacent list) - Locations that are at the edge of the board

      • testAdjacencyOnlyWalkway

        public void testAdjacencyOnlyWalkway()
        - Testing adjacency for a cell that only has walkway as adjacency - Testing locations that are doorways only. These are marked as PURPLE on the planning spreadsheet

      • testAdjacencyBesidesRoomCell

        public void testAdjacencyBesidesRoomCell()
        - Testing Locations that are besides a room cell that is not a doorway - Testing Locations that are adjacent to a doorway with direction (this includes the doorway itself in the adjacency list) These tests are GREEN in the planning spreadsheet

      • testAdjacencyWalkwaysVariety

        public void testAdjacencyWalkwaysVariety()
        Test variety of walkway scenarios - Tests the bottom edge of the board These are marked as RED on the spreadsheet

      • testTargetsOneStepAdjEdgeDoorway

        public void testTargetsOneStepAdjEdgeDoorway()
        ============================================== Target Testing ============================================================= In the testTargetOneStep() - Testing target of length 1 - Testing Location with only walkway as adjacent locations - Locations that are besides a room cell that is not a doorway - Locations that are at the edge of the board - Locations that are adjacent to a doorway with directions. We have direction RIGHT These are PINK on the planning spreadsheet

      • testTargetsTwoStepsAdjDoorway

        public void testTargetsTwoStepsAdjDoorway()
        In testTargetsTwoSteps() I am testing a different distance of size 2 - Testing locations that are adjacent to doorway, in this case UP and DOWN These are LIGHT BLUE on the spreadsheet

      • testTargetsFourStepsAdjDoorway

        public void testTargetsFourStepsAdjDoorway()
        Testing a step size of 4 - Locations that are adjacent to a doorway with needed directions. This time we have LEFT and RIGHT, so now we have all 4 locations This is DARK BLUE on the spreadsheet

      • testTargetsIntoRoom

        public void testTargetsIntoRoom()
        Testing getting into rooms These tests are in LIGHT PURLE on the spreadsheet
